summary: Headcanon that Tony Stark sometimes supply teaches tech/shop classes at local high schools for free when budget is tight, or to...
body: Headcanon that Tony Stark sometimes supply teaches tech/shop classes at local high schools for free when budget is tight, or to just give the teachers a break. He shows up and the kids lose it for a little bit, but then they settle down and listen. It gives them hope, because everyone always trashes the trades and people who work them, but this genius, billionaire, playboy, philanthropist took time to teach them this class. He knows trades, and he thinks they’re worth something. He thinks these kids are worth something.

title: Five Years
body:
read it on the AO3 at https://ift.tt/2FeQHKt

by cazmalfoy

“Why’d you only have one arm?”

“Cut it off to see what would happen.“

Five-year old Tony Stark didn’t realise it, but he’d fallen in love with James Barnes in that moment.

*

Five year snapshots of Tony and James’s lives, in 200 word snippets.

summary: [Working Title] Bucky, Steve, and the troublemakers
title: [Working Title] Bucky, Steve, and the troublemakers
body:
read it on the AO3 at https://ift.tt/2zs6b7Q

by GLiTCH_R

[Still huge work-in-progress!!] Steve and Bucky fall out of the sky in a tiny little town in the middle of nowhere. And find themselves in the company of two girls they just can not get rid of.

[This work is a co-written fiction between me and a friend, Madi! Forgive, but this work is entirely freeform. It started out as just having fun but then became a more complete story. We wrote it back and forth, sort of like a relay. Forgive it if it’s a bit messy. Okay, a lot messy. ^^“ composition is very lax, you’ve been warned! If you dare, have fun!]

summary: Peter Parker is an exhausted boy, and Iron Dad can always relate
body:
Peter Parker is an exhausted boy, and Iron Dad can always relate

i think a lotta people forget peter is a teenager sometimes tbh. appreciate this one shot i made

Words: 1927

“Mr. Parker, where is your assignment?” Miss Warren asked, startling the sleepy boy out of his exhausted state. He raised a brow, mind sluggish, running at a pace of a turtle before he could reply.

“Here, Miss. Lemme… lemme just get it out for you,” he croaked while reaching into his backpack. Peter had being staying up all night- all nights, the whole week- leaving him weary and stressed. Well, he was stressed anyway, and was actually a factor of why he had sleeping issues, but the problems kept building up.

First there was school. That was in the homework aspect, Flash picking on him and the fact he had a creeping suspicion Michelle knew who he was. The whole idea of someone so close to him, not including Ned, knowing who he was? That kept him up at night. The last thing he wanted was to put them in harm’s way.

Then there was the pressure of being Spider-Man, the crippling weight on his shoulders that made him wilt, slowly becoming deader as the seemingly endless nights dragged out. Everyone expected the hero to save them now. He wasn’t big like Iron Man, but New Yorkers who knew Spider-Man was. He could see some t-shirts being worn every so often with his small, iconic symbol on them, and while that was heart-warming and absolutely hilarious to see, it also meant people relied on him. That was okay. He had taken that responsibility when Uncle Ben had mentioned that other’s would rely on him,  but God, thousands- no, millions of people of the city relied on him to come save them, from muggings, from assaulters, to robbers, to simple drunk people stumbling around, yelling curses like they were Deadpool or just some deranged mercenary.

Peter accepted the responsibility.

“Are you an Avenger, Spider-Man?”

“Spider-Man, you’re the best!”

“Spider-man could never fail us!”

“Spider-Man, help me!”

People expected him to be the next Iron Man, the next Thor, even the next Hulk, hell, even the next Scarlett Witch. The stress was overwhelming. Not just the people expected it; Tony-freaking-Stark expected it. And the last thing he wanted to do was disappoint him- never again.

With Bugle-named ‘Green Goblin’ began creeping around; Peter’s life became insanely hard. He had bruises all over his body, and bones that were either cracked or bruised as well. Whatever it was, whatever he was doing, that mentally unstable guy would ruin his night, strangling him, blowing him up, shouting puns that weren’t even funny because he was so scary (some could argue though that puns are the scariest form of humour.)

Of course, the most pressuring of all, Harry Osborn. Aside from Ned, he was his best friend. No, Ned came second in the friend race, actually… Something was off with him. He was turning up late; his hair tussled; sunglasses resting on his perfectly angled nose, all the while he sported a fake grin. Peter knew that grin anywhere. It was the kind that took years to perfect, the ones celebrities used in front of paparazzi to get them to leave. His father, Norman Osborn, also did this. Even Tony Stark, too.

But it didn’t fool Peter. He knew what his real smile was like, dazzling and pretty.

He wanted to ask what was wrong, but it never seemed like the right time to ask, because every time he did those eyes of his would turn so sad, so full of pain and agony his heart clenched and yearned to support him. He couldn’t force him to share, so all he could offer was a shoulder to cry on. And Harry had never cried in front of him through their years of being friends.

“Mr. Parker?”

While Peter had been drowning in somewhat self-pity and sadness, he had forgotten to hand in his over-due paper. He did, avoiding her eyes, and Miss Warren looked at him expectedly.

“Have you been sleeping lately? You look tired.” She motioned to the dark bags under his eyes. Peter blushed.

“Yep, been sleeping… Um… Can I go now, Miss? I need to get home.” For a moment, the teacher hesitated, before sighing and moving out the way. He bucked out the room. Out there was Osborn himself, sunglasses perched on his nose and he licked his bottom lip.

“Pete, come on, let’s go.” He smiled, only to receive a small shake of Peter’s head.

“Not today, sorry, Har. I… um… I really have to go to the Stark Internship.” A frown tugged at Harry’s face, bitter and harsh, and it rolled so quickly into sympathy and genuine sadness that Peter thought his mind had deceived him.

“Oh. I get it,” his voice was soft, “yeah. You need to go. Go.” Harry said and put his hands in his designer jacket. Peter rubbed the back of his neck and pulled the taller boy in for a quick hug, smiled, then pulled back. “Thanks, Har. But I’ve got to go. Bye!” He grinned. Harry mirrored his expression, “go get ‘em, tiger.” He said teasingly, knowing what was happening between MJ and Peter.

The boy flushed a dark red all over again, and he was reminded harshly that MJ liked him. Like a hammer on an iron, pain hurt his heart. He wasn’t good enough for her. He always let her down. “Shut up, Osborn.” He snapped playfully and attempted to ruffle his hair, but Harry pulled back. His hair was “styled,” Harry reminded, winking at him. “My hair is styled, Pete.”

“Okay, Mr. Perfect. I have to go, bye!” He grinned and began to run down the now empty hallways.

Harry sighed under his breath and pulled the sunglasses off, rubbing the bridge of his nose. Good, he thought, he hasn’t noticed.

After a hurried train journey where he was itching to be the web-slinger again, he burst through Avenger’s HQ (or ‘America’s dreamboat meet up place’ he had once called it as a joke.) Tony was in his office as usual and the excited boy ran up the stairs since he hated his strength to be wasted with a slow elevator ride, and halted outside the door.

“I’m a mess,” he murmured to himself and sorted his shirt out. He suddenly found himself out of breath, and at the first moment he wondered if he was having a panic attack. But then he realised he was out of breath from running up the stairs. Huh. Weird. That doesn’t happen.

Despite this, he raised his fist to knock at the door but Pepper gladly opened it. FRIDAY had most likely announced his arrival.

“Come in,” she smiled warmly, and a small spark of happiness brought a smirk to his face. He strolled in, the faint smell of alcohol in the air (thanks heightened senses) and nothing had changed since he last came there, which was yesterday.

“He’s in his office,” she supplied and went back to the paperwork she was assigned. Peter nodded.

He slowly opened the door and noticed Tony working on some new suit, eyes focused and sweat trickling down his forehead.

“Mr. Stark,” he said, trying to make his voice enthusiastic and not drag and slur with the need to sleep.

“Oh, hey, kid- whoa, what happened to you?” He asked, half joking and half concerned. Peter let ou a breathless laugh at sat beside him. “Just stress. School and stuff.”

Tony nodded seriously, “yeah, school and stuff.” It took his slow mind to realise he was actually teasing him, and he was tempted to lightly punch him in the shoulder for fun, but they weren’t there yet.

 “Psh, nothing   I can bore you with.” He said and stared at the thing he was tinkering with, slowly realising it was a boot for the upcoming Iron Man suit.

“Sure, I’m bored enough. You think i do this for fun?”

“So having a teen ranting about his issues is your fun?”

“Never know.”

It was an hour of bouncing back ideas from one and other when Peter covered a yawn with the back of his hand, muffling the sound.

“You tired?” Stark asked, lifting up his eye protection to see the boy.

“I guess,” Peter had slumped against his chair and cradled his head in his hands. He then lifted his eyes up and tried to grab his tea Mrs Potts (or Stark, now) had given him, but dizziness caused him to completely miss.

No… Not in front of Mr. Stark. What would he think if he couldn’t even pick up a mug for God’s sake?

Tony frowned and sat on his own chair, using the desk to push off and roll all the way over to him. “Man, I wish actually made eye contact. Those eye bags are bigger than my ego, kid.”

Peter wanted to roll his eyes, but he couldn’t bring himself to do it. “Whatever,” he grumbled.

“Whoa, you getting moody with me? Tellin’ you, there’s no reason to get bitchy with me.”

“Right, sorry, I’m sorry, Mr. Stark. Really, I am…” He sighed, feeling dreadful of how he wa such a teenager towards Stark. Tony shrugged, “wanna talk about what’s keeping you up?”

“Uhh… Spider-Man stuff?” He offered, but his heart wasn’t in his words.

“That can’t be the only thing keeping you up, Pete, can it?” He asked, and Peter’s heart throbbed. He wanted to tell him, tell him what was going on inside his busy mind of his, how he felt, how much he was aching and how much he just wanted to sob.

So, Peter started out with the simplest thing of homework and ended up sobbing huge tears that rolled down his face like rivers, talking about Green Goblin, Harry, the fact everyone was expecting him to do so good, but the pressure was getting to him. Really, really badly. His face was flushed and nose was running, and his hair had puffed up since he was stressfully tugging at his curls left and right. His chest constricted, and he found it hard to breathe, so he choked on air, making small, retching sounds between broken sentences.

He closed his mouth after a good half-an-hour, feeling so, so embarrassed that Mr. Stark had seen him whimper and sob like a traumatised child, and he pulled his legs up to his chest. His breaths were wet and thick. “Sorry, Mr. Stark… You have your own problems to worry about, didn’t mean to burden you with-“

And before he could finish his sentence, Tony’s arms had wrapped around him and he gently stroked up his back. Not like Tony Stark at all. All the same, Peter clung onto him like a life line, sniffling as to not get any snot on his shoulder. “It’s fine, kid. It’s alright. Take a nap- go on- go take a nap on my couch,” he register to his rich sofa, and Peter shook his head, and the millionaire pulled away awkwardly.

“No, I couldn—“

“Go. Now.” He said, and Peter got up, shameful and bashful, and laid himself down, draping his limbs uncomfortably over it. He didn’t want to seem rude. “I’ll tinker around but won’t make too much noise, okay? Get some rest, kid.”

“Mr. Stark?”

“Yeah.”

“Thank you.”

And with that, Peter shut down like a light. Tony smiled, and jumped when Pepper whispered, “you said you wanted a kid, right? You seem like perfect dad.” She smiled, and he lightly pushed her away. No words were needed but for them to kiss, and everything was explained simple as that.

The boy flushed a dark red all over again, and he was reminded harshly that MJ liked him. Like a hammer on an iron, pain hurt his heart. He wasn’t good enough for her. He always let her down. “Shut up, Osborn.” He snapped playfully and attempted to ruffle his hair, but Harry pulled back. His hair was “styled,” Harry reminded, winking at him. “My hair is styled, Pete.”

“Okay, Mr. Perfect. I have to go, bye!” He grinned and began to run down the now empty hallways.

Harry sighed under his breath and pulled the sunglasses off, rubbing the bridge of his nose. Good, he thought, he hasn’t noticed.

After a hurried train journey where he was itching to be the web-slinger again, he burst through Avenger’s HQ (or ‘America’s dreamboat meet up place’ he had once called it as a joke.) Tony was in his office as usual and the excited boy ran up the stairs since he hated his strength to be wasted with a slow elevator ride, and halted outside the door.

“I’m a mess,” he murmured to himself and sorted his shirt out. He suddenly found himself out of breath, and at the first moment he wondered if he was having a panic attack. But then he realised he was out of breath from running up the stairs. Huh. Weird. That doesn’t happen.

Despite this, he raised his fist to knock at the door but Pepper gladly opened it. FRIDAY had most likely announced his arrival.

“Come in,” she smiled warmly, and a small spark of happiness brought a smirk to his face. He strolled in, the faint smell of alcohol in the air (thanks heightened senses) and nothing had changed since he last came there, which was yesterday.

“He’s in his office,” she supplied and went back to the paperwork she was assigned. Peter nodded.

He slowly opened the door and noticed Tony working on some new suit, eyes focused and sweat trickling down his forehead.

“Mr. Stark,” he said, trying to make his voice enthusiastic and not drag and slur with the need to sleep.

“Oh, hey, kid- whoa, what happened to you?” He asked, half joking and half concerned. Peter let ou a breathless laugh at sat beside him. “Just stress. School and stuff.”

Tony nodded seriously, “yeah, school and stuff.” It took his slow mind to realise he was actually teasing him, and he was tempted to lightly punch him in the shoulder for fun, but they weren’t there yet.

 “Psh, nothing   I can bore you with.” He said and stared at the thing he was tinkering with, slowly realising it was a boot for the upcoming Iron Man suit.

“Sure, I’m bored enough. You think i do this for fun?”

“So having a teen ranting about his issues is your fun?”

“Never know.”

It was an hour of bouncing back ideas from one and other when Peter covered a yawn with the back of his hand, muffling the sound.

“You tired?” Stark asked, lifting up his eye protection to see the boy.

“I guess,” Peter had slumped against his chair and cradled his head in his hands. He then lifted his eyes up and tried to grab his tea Mrs Potts (or Stark, now) had given him, but dizziness caused him to completely miss.

No… Not in front of Mr. Stark. What would he think if he couldn’t even pick up a mug for God’s sake?

Tony frowned and sat on his own chair, using the desk to push off and roll all the way over to him. “Man, I wish actually made eye contact. Those eye bags are bigger than my ego, kid.”

Peter wanted to roll his eyes, but he couldn’t bring himself to do it. “Whatever,” he grumbled.

“Whoa, you getting moody with me? Tellin’ you, there’s no reason to get bitchy with me.”

“Right, sorry, I’m sorry, Mr. Stark. Really, I am…” He sighed, feeling dreadful of how he wa such a teenager towards Stark. Tony shrugged, “wanna talk about what’s keeping you up?”

“Uhh… Spider-Man stuff?” He offered, but his heart wasn’t in his words.

“That can’t be the only thing keeping you up, Pete, can it?” He asked, and Peter’s heart throbbed. He wanted to tell him, tell him what was going on inside his busy mind of his, how he felt, how much he was aching and how much he just wanted to sob.

So, Peter started out with the simplest thing of homework and ended up sobbing huge tears that rolled down his face like rivers, talking about Green Goblin, Harry, the fact everyone was expecting him to do so good, but the pressure was getting to him. Really, really badly. His face was flushed and nose was running, and his hair had puffed up since he was stressfully tugging at his curls left and right. His chest constricted, and he found it hard to breathe, so he choked on air, making small, retching sounds between broken sentences.

He closed his mouth after a good half-an-hour, feeling so, so embarrassed that Mr. Stark had seen him whimper and sob like a traumatised child, and he pulled his legs up to his chest. His breaths were wet and thick. “Sorry, Mr. Stark… You have your own problems to worry about, didn’t mean to burden you with-“

And before he could finish his sentence, Tony’s arms had wrapped around him and he gently stroked up his back. Not like Tony Stark at all. All the same, Peter clung onto him like a life line, sniffling as to not get any snot on his shoulder. “It’s fine, kid. It’s alright. Take a nap- go on- go take a nap on my couch,” he register to his rich sofa, and Peter shook his head, and the millionaire pulled away awkwardly.

“No, I couldn—“

“Go. Now.” He said, and Peter got up, shameful and bashful, and laid himself down, draping his limbs uncomfortably over it. He didn’t want to seem rude. “I’ll tinker around but won’t make too much noise, okay? Get some rest, kid.”

“Mr. Stark?”

“Yeah.”

“Thank you.”

And with that, Peter shut down like a light. Tony smiled, and jumped when Pepper whispered, “you said you wanted a kid, right? You seem like perfect dad.” She smiled, and he lightly pushed her away. No words were needed but for them to kiss, and everything was explained simple as that.

Peter Parker is an exhausted boy, and Iron Dad can always relate

i think a lotta people forget peter is a teenager sometimes tbh. appreciate this one shot i made

“Mr. Parker, where is your assignment?” Miss Warren asked, startling the sleepy boy out of his exhausted state. He raised a brow, mind sluggish, running at a pace of a turtle before he could reply.

“Here, Miss. Lemme… lemme just get it out for you,” he croaked while reaching into his backpack. Peter had being staying up all night- all nights, the whole week- leaving him weary and stressed. Well, he was stressed anyway, and was actually a factor of why he had sleeping issues, but the problems kept building up.

First there was school. That was in the homework aspect, Flash picking on him and the fact he had a creeping suspicion Michelle knew who he was. The whole idea of someone so close to him, not including Ned, knowing who he was? That kept him up at night. The last thing he wanted was to put them in harm’s way.

Then there was the pressure of being Spider-Man, the crippling weight on his shoulders that made him wilt, slowly becoming deader as the seemingly endless nights dragged out. Everyone expected the hero to save them now. He wasn’t big like Iron Man, but New Yorkers who knew Spider-Man was. He could see some t-shirts being worn every so often with his small, iconic symbol on them, and while that was heart-warming and absolutely hilarious to see, it also meant people relied on him. That was okay. He had taken that responsibility when Uncle Ben had mentioned that other’s would rely on him,  but God, thousands- no, millions of people of the city relied on him to come save them, from muggings, from assaulters, to robbers, to simple drunk people stumbling around, yelling curses like they were Deadpool or just some deranged mercenary.

Peter accepted the responsibility.

“Are you an Avenger, Spider-Man?”

“Spider-Man, you’re the best!”

“Spider-man could never fail us!”

“Spider-Man, help me!”

People expected him to be the next Iron Man, the next Thor, even the next Hulk, hell, even the next Scarlett Witch. The stress was overwhelming. Not just the people expected it; Tony-freaking-Stark expected it. And the last thing he wanted to do was disappoint him- never again.

With Bugle-named ‘Green Goblin’ began creeping around; Peter’s life became insanely hard. He had bruises all over his body, and bones that were either cracked or bruised as well. Whatever it was, whatever he was doing, that mentally unstable guy would ruin his night, strangling him, blowing him up, shouting puns that weren’t even funny because he was so scary (some could argue though that puns are the scariest form of humour.)

Of course, the most pressuring of all, Harry Osborn. Aside from Ned, he was his best friend. No, Ned came second in the friend race, actually… Something was off with him. He was turning up late; his hair tussled; sunglasses resting on his perfectly angled nose, all the while he sported a fake grin. Peter knew that grin anywhere. It was the kind that took years to perfect, the ones celebrities used in front of paparazzi to get them to leave. His father, Norman Osborn, also did this. Even Tony Stark, too.

But it didn’t fool Peter. He knew what his real smile was like, dazzling and pretty.

He wanted to ask what was wrong, but it never seemed like the right time to ask, because every time he did those eyes of his would turn so sad, so full of pain and agony his heart clenched and yearned to support him. He couldn’t force him to share, so all he could offer was a shoulder to cry on. And Harry had never cried in front of him through their years of being friends.

“Mr. Parker?”

While Peter had been drowning in somewhat self-pity and sadness, he had forgotten to hand in his over-due paper. He did, avoiding her eyes, and Miss Warren looked at him expectedly.

“Have you been sleeping lately? You look tired.” She motioned to the dark bags under his eyes. Peter blushed.

“Yep, been sleeping… Um… Can I go now, Miss? I need to get home.” For a moment, the teacher hesitated, before sighing and moving out the way. He bucked out the room. Out there was Osborn himself, sunglasses perched on his nose and he licked his bottom lip.

“Pete, come on, let’s go.” He smiled, only to receive a small shake of Peter’s head.

“Not today, sorry, Har. I… um… I really have to go to the Stark Internship.” A frown tugged at Harry’s face, bitter and harsh, and it rolled so quickly into sympathy and genuine sadness that Peter thought his mind had deceived him.

“Oh. I get it,” his voice was soft, “yeah. You need to go. Go.” Harry said and put his hands in his designer jacket. Peter rubbed the back of his neck and pulled the taller boy in for a quick hug, smiled, then pulled back. “Thanks, Har. But I’ve got to go. Bye!” He grinned.
